Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fleming”
Reviews.Author: 108Mary
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fleming, took two rooms for four nights for myself, husband and two kids in Feb 2012. I found hotel, clean, practical, servicable, safe. I found it good value and staff fine for price. Great location with many good inexpensive restaurants nearby. We would walk back from Zocalo or Belles Artes at night with no issues. Very close metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and well placed”
Reviews.Author: Sirish_21
Reviews.Content: I would say its a good place if you want to be at the downtown and prefer economical living. Rooms are good and big. Luckily most of the staff understands and speaks little English so its convenient for you. From the perspective of exploring Mexico city, hotel is at walking distance from the Metro stations (Balderas and Juarez) and also you have couple of MetroBus stations near by. The artisan market is also a 4-5 mins walk from the hotel. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that they want the payment everyday morning. Some of the staff is friendly and greets you with a smile and some staff seems a a little rude probably because of the language barrier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: szombat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, some 1 km from Zocalo, clean and big enough rooms, clean bathrooms, towels changed every day, room service cleaned the room perfectly every day, comfortable beds, the windows do not isolate noise and cold from outside, some receptionist were a bit nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever been!”
Reviews.Author: traveller854
Reviews.Content: I am student, so i have slept in a lot of hotels and even hostel, but none of them were so bad as this one.This Hotel has nice look from the outside and its reasonable piriced, but thats all. It already starts with the arrive, the receptionist was extremely unfriendly, but not only him the whole staff terribly unfriendly. And this goes on with the hotel room. The room was clean and had proper internet. But this should be normal in a hotel. But the bed was rock hard, couldn´t sleep well there, sleep each night for 4 hours as well as my friend did, still have backpain. Actually wanted to stay there for a week, but after two night I had to skip the hotel and go to another one. So if you dont care about comfort and service this should be your hotel, but then you could also go to a hostel. It would be half price and you would probably get better service then in this so called " hotel" . My honest opinion: Please dont go to this hotel! I am now in Hotel Segovia Regency, it cost 160 pesos more for two persons, and its really good, friendly competent staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Feel lucky to have found the Fleming!”
Reviews.Author: Band1t
Reviews.Content: I have been pleasantly surprised with the Fleming hotel. My friend suggested we stay here and it has been a good experience. The front desk has been helpful with good patience for English people. The restaurant was ok. But the 2nd day I was treated very poorly. No worries there is lots of places to eat nearby. The room was 550 pesos with a jaccuzi. ... Very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to visit Mexico Center”
Reviews.Author: Damslapougne
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night there. Staff isn't really sympathetic, they just do the job. LOCATION 10min walk from historic center, 2min walk from the Metro station Juarez. Quiet place (for Mexico City...) SERVICES Breakfast is included but there's a restaurant. We just had breakfast there, it's not really expensive and OK. There's free WIFI even in the room. They provide a PC but you'll have to pay. I don't recommand to use it, because the payment system isn't pratical and expensive, you can find internet cafe 200m in the North East. ROOMS Quite big (6m x 4m), clean. Beds are kind of hard but enough confortable. We chose a "court" view room (don't expect any view), it was quiet enough. I recommand this hotel to visit Mexico City, even if the staff isn't really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, not bad”
Reviews.Author: juan_maldonado
Reviews.Content: Great for the price, pretty close to all the fun things in the middle of the historic center. Rooms are clean. We stayed Sunday night and it was loud across the street but by 10 PM, it died down. The staff is rather unsmiling. If you don't care about that sort of thing, it's fine but it's a little eerie to get extremely efficient service... and blank stares. Three things: we stayed two nights and both mornings, there was a natural gas odor in our room. It was a little unsettling. I also phoned the restaurant to ask if there was free or discounted breakfasts for guests and his answer was pretty rude. No worries; there's plenty of great places to eat nearby. Lastly, we phoned a nearby restaurant about their hours and the call was less than a minute but the charge wound up being about $32 (pesos). Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Very convinent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenlynn2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. the staff was very friendly. I speak very little spanish but I was still able to communicate with them because most of them spoke a little english. The restaurant was nice but I would not eat there more than a couple of time because there are so many different restaurants that are only a couple blocks away. I was traveling with a small group (20 people). The elevator was very small and it took us all a long time to get our stuff upstairs. Also the sound carries in the hallways very well. We could hear our neighbors conversations. No washcloths, but that is very common in Mexico so bring your own. Very good location for sight seeing, many things are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Haliku
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, safe and centrally located hotel this hidden gem is worth a taxi ride from the airport. While the neighborhood might seem a little seedy to someone new to latin american travel I never felt unsafe at any hour of the day or night. Alameda Park is just two blocks away and several more blocks of walking will get you to the Zocalo (main square). Some of the rooms are a little small so if you are staying for several nights ask for a little more space. The staff is quite helpful and many have been there for years.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Returned (and Receptionist Actually Smiled!!)”
Reviews.Author: AAJetMan
Reviews.Content: My first return visit to the Fleming, and room 506 reassured my why I returned. Love the jacuzzi, a great deal at 500 pesos. Excellent hot water supply in the shower. Large, comfy bed. I just wish that the window would open more as the room got a bit warm. The restaurant staff was wonderful (Hello Juan!!), and the food high-caliber -- nice variety with a Mexican flair. This trip I went out of my way to try to get somebody from the reception desk to smile, having read reviews that it didn't happen, and observing so myself last Septermber. Well, it WORKED!! The lady at the front desk smiled and was quite helpful. Never got the male working there to commit, but he was still very helpful, just in a perfunctory manner. Man, this hotel's great location makes it a bargain. A few blocks from Alameda/Bellas Artes/Sheraton. Lots of shops and street vendors in the surrounding blocks. Zocalo not far, and either a long walk along Reforma, or a ~10-minute taxi to Chapultepec. It's also just 2 blocks from the Metro Juarez. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: WebDeveloper2008
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Fleming, and decided to stay there again, after a horrible experience at another hotel just down the street. I'll talk about that one in a minute. The location is perfect. The restaurant offers good affordable food and they're open until 11pm. No complaints about the room itself, it was very big and clean, and what you would expect at a Holiday Inn type of hotel. I would also have to agree with the other reviewer that the television cable was not all that good and the computer in the lobby was a little outdated. However they do offer free wi-fi, if you bring your own laptop (which I would advise not doing). Nevertheless there are several inexpensive internet cafe's nearby. The staff was mediocre in my opinion and were not really that helpful or friendly. It seemed like most of the front staff were not happy to be there. That was one of my dislikes about the hotel, especially after staying with them for about 11 nights. They did not offer any type of discounts for extended stay visitors. Secondly, the actual exterior of the building itself isnt that attractive. Also no AC, but they did have a ceiling fan, which seemed to suffice. Finally, street noise is an issue if you are assigned a room facing the street, so I would reccommend opting for an interior room. The neighborhood iffy, and it seems that the Flemming sits right on the border of ghetto and safe-area. To the north, adjacent to the Park and Juarez Ave, there are other hotels and restaurants, and bakeries. The Sheraton Tower is in that direction and the metro, Starbucks, Zocalo, and all museums and sights are within walking distance. However, To the south, Be Careful! This is the area which is more industrial. It seems to cater to tradesmen, electricians and plumbers. About a week into our stay at the Flemming we came across another hotel- The Conde. This hotel is located in this industrial area, situated about 2 blocks south of the Flemming. Everything seemed almost the same, minus the restaurant and security glass seperating the front desk and clients. The room was standard, and at the amazing price of $18, we decided to give it a try for a couple of days to try to save some money. This is a decision I now regret. After coming back from shopping for about 6 hours, we discovered that our new laptop computer, Ipod, and expensive camera were stolen from the room. I had the key on me the entire day, and nobody else had access to the room, except for the Hotel Conde staff. Obviously they denied having any involvement, or knowing anything. Just the kind of thing you hear about in Mexico, "I dont know anything". Unfortunately, the police couldnt help much either. Of course its not the end of the world, but just a little bitter sweet reminder and lesson that trying to bargain hunt in Mexico City is not the most wise thing to be thinking about. Mexico is not the United States. That day we returned to the Hotel Flemming, and managed to have a great time for the rest of our stay. So I would definitely reccomend the Hotel Flemming to anyone, and plan on staying there again when I return this September.

Reviews.Title: “solid budget option, great location”
Reviews.Author: KevinShea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only two blocks from the Sheraton Centro Historico and about 15-20 minutes from the Zocalo. There are a ton of restaurants (real ones and Mexican "al fresco" ones in the park), bars, clubs and sights in the area. The metro is great, but this hotel's location makes the central area very walkable. Maid service was average, the front desk speaks no English and I did not eat in the restaurant as I wanted to be in a vibrant Mexico City and not my hotel, but $35 per night (in a holiday week) makes it a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms with good location”
Reviews.Author: peter_homefield
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fleming is a business-like hotel. Clean and tidy but not fancy. Location is just fine near Zokalo. Rooms are quite small for our family of 5 but for two they are just fine. Internet connection in the rooms is lacking, there is just a coin operated pc in the lobby. Ok stay if you look for good hotel to overnight. Breakfast is overpriced, that gives some minus.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience for a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Fred&Maisie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Fleming (the first was in 2002). This moderately inexpensive hotel ($USD 45) is conveniently located south of the Alameda and is very close to the Juarez Metro Station. It is an excellent choice if you want to see the sites of the central historic district as you can enjoy the walk either along Ave Indepencia or the Alameda or take the Metro if your feet are sore. It is an easy bus ride (4 or 5 pesos) to the outstanding museums at Chapultepec. Out bound catch one labeled Auditorio on Paseo de Reforma, look for one labelled Hidalgo to return. Although the rooms are small, they are clean, well-furnished, and comfortable. TV, no AC, but did have a ceiling fan. There is an elevator. Beds are hard, but extra pillows are available. Staff were very responsive. The most awkward part about this hotel is the lack of e-mail or website. We arrived without a reservation but you can call them directly for a reservation, as they will find someone who speaks English to take your call. Bottled water is available for an extra charge. The restaurant is also a good value, with long hours. The neighborhood is in transition. To the north, adjacent to the Alameda, new hotels are under construction and Avenue Indepencia, 1 block north of the Hotel has lots of services including a good bakery and a DHL/shipping store where you can get boxes to pack your souvenirs even if you check them as baggage. To the south, it seems to be a neighborhood of kitchen fixtures and appliances, Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trusk_01
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at the Hotel Fleming because the most recent review in Trip Advisor was from several years ago, but I decided to give it a try. I was more than happy I did. The hotel is in a great location, a pleasant walk to the Zocalo, two blocks from Parque Alameda, close to several metro stations. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff was exceptional. I will be returning to Mexico City in November and will definetly be staying at Hotel Fleming.

Reviews.Title: “Good lodgings at ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best value for the money in Mexico City, we feel. Ideal location -- halfway between the Zocalo and Chapultepec, walking distance from Alameda Park and Bellas Artes. Just across the street is the Restaurant Lincoln, one of the city's best kept secrets. We never consider staying anywhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fleming
HotelInfo.Address: Revillagigedo 35 | Centro, Mexico City 06050, Mexico
